comments.text: It's a good spot. Nobody tried to kiss me. Got a ride to next closest city. There's a lot of places to pull over and cars see you from far.
Got a ride in a few minutes. Unfortunately he was trying to kiss me (f), be careful of the men, but many cars going that way
All traffic heading to Al-Karak from north/south should go through here; tell your driver to drop you at Al-Qatrana interchange if they're continuing

Literally the first car stopped by me and gave a ride to Azraq. Old man and his grandson shown me local castles when we were passing them and we had a nice chat using translator. Not much traffic, but people always stop. In Jordan you can hitchhike anywhere and get a ride unlike in Europe, so no worries about hitchhiking on the highway(I am talking about you, Netherlands, f*ck your rules and your 150 euro fine)

It was an easy hitchhike.

The guys didn't just drop me off, but invited me to their house, where we shared meal with their families, shared stories and just sharing a great social experience. They offered me a place for sleep, but I told that I want to go further, so they dropped me at the highway again and helped me find a driver to the next destination. They also gave me 15 euros in Jordan money, so I can buy something for myself. Very positive ^^

Not much of the traffic but people are friendly and stop for you almost always. Got a ride to the Jordan-Saudi Arabia border after 10 mins of waiting. Driver gave me some Jordan money to cover transit to Saudi Arabia, as crossing border by walking is forbidden

Crossing border to Saudi Arabia is very tricky. It's forbidden to cross by walking, so you need to find a car, but most people refuse because they are afraid you may have something illegal with you. 

I ended up at this station and asked people around for help. There are people that would get you through border if you pay, but I got lucky and met Jordan family who gave me a meal and decided to pay to one "smuggler" to help me cross the border if I also help with his "scheme" of buying cigarett

It's a gas station in this area. It was a blast. There are a lot of trucks going directly to Amman, any car that has container on it goes directly there. I was dropped there and found a ride to Amman literally after 1 minute of hitchhiking

The place right opposite to the hotel. There's a lot of place for cars of any kind to stop there. Waited not more than 10 minutes for a local man and his son to take me all the way to Ma'an where it was even easier to hitchhike to Amman.
Fewer cars somehow, walked to the edge of town and got picked up after few mins. Took me farther to the main road
Got a ride quick, many tourists stop here for photos
Many people going back and forth, just confirm it's free. Balash or ma fi masari
Anywhere along this road people will pick you up quick. Even locals hitchhike super easy.

Hitchhiking in Jordan is in general super easy if you are a European tourist, everybody wants to help you and you never wait more than 10 minutes no matter where you are, carefull though because many times people expect you to give them money for the ride, so you have to make clear from the beginning that you are hitchhiking, we went directly from Aqaba to Wadi Rum which is a very popular destination
Easy spot. A lot of place to stop after Wadi Rum turn. A truck driver stopped after just 10 minutes of waiting and took me halfway to Petra
Good spot locals hitchhike too.
Lot of traffic going back to Wadi Musa on Saturday; got a ride to Shobek with a cop eventually
On a saturday morning quite a lot cars hedaing to north. near the spot is a famous spring with drinking water where you can refill your bottle for free.
It's kind of weird intersection, but here's for going north from Wadi Musa/Petra along the King's Highway. Quite a steep uphill to get here, hope you're in shape ;)
Opposite a cafe after the; village, you can rest on some concrete barriers
Not a lot of traffic but you should be able to get a ride to the desert highway or further from here

Police checkpoint here. They took my passport and made some calls telling me, it's all good just wait. They had stopped a school bus going to wadi rum, and basically forced me on it, and not letting me try for a car. Everyone was friendly and only took a few mins
